reviewText: Travis are one of those rare bands that can make every tune catchy and melodic, a talent rarely seen these days. "More Than Us" is a DVD that showcases their awsome live shows, which is a treat even for those who haven't seen them live before. Personally, I have seen them live 4 times, and have never had a dull moment.The DVD layout is simple. It contains the full concert (filmed at two summer festivals in 2001) featuring highlights from all three of their albums, a documentary filmed on the road with the band, multiple camera angles, a setlist selector (you can pick which songs you want to hear first), and a nice interactive menu. The extras are not all that exciting, but the concert itself more than makes up for it.The highlights are the "Cast of thousands", the audience, who  obviously knows every word to every song and sings in perfect harmony with Fran, Andy Dunlop's stage antics, and the entire setlist, which is filled with all their hits. Musical highlights are "Sing", "Writing to Reach You", "Turn", "The Humpty Dumpty Love Song", and "U16 Girls". This is to name a few.This is a DVD that will make you realize what a terrific band Travis is, in case you were in doubt before. Their catchy and inspired tunes, combined with their cheery, down to earth nature mean that value for your money is guaranteed.
summary: An amazing live act, not to be underestimated.
Title: N/A

reviewText: this is a really incredible dvd experience.  i bought the dvd just because i saw them on letterman once or something and i had the cds but never saw them in concert.  well the picture quality, sound quality, length and song choice in the dvd are perfect.  fran healy's voice is spot on and many of these tracks sound even better than the recorded versions on the cds! a must have!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD captures Travis proving to thousands why they're a great rock band.  They returned to their home town of Glasgow in 2001 and played an amazing set that you can now enjoy over and over again.  Comprised of 19 powerful songs, a great stage presence, Fran's playful banter, and some documentary footage, this concert was something I wish I could have experienced.  The director does a fantastic job of using many cameras and effects to make the experience even more pleasurable.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A nice music DVD accomplishes concert with behind the scene doco professionally.Recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoy putting a concert DVD on while I do other things, like paying bills, etc. and this is a very good DVD.  There are several good extras on this DVD to give you a look at this very level headed band.  If you are a fan of Travis, this DVD is definately worth purchasing, because the audio is very good, and the crowd is just awesome.  If you are not a big fan of Travis, i.e. you don't own their CD's, I'd skip this.
Title: N/A
